Collectively, the private sector can make a big difference. And we‚Äôll make an even bigger difference if we work with government and civil society to place water high on the climate agenda. Let‚Äôs go make it happen!
Reducing water also means saving money on your water and energy bills, getting more resilient to climate-induced #WaterScarcity and leaving more water for the community. It‚Äôs a no-brainer.

Here‚Äôs a to-do for the private sector: When you use water, you have to pump it, heat it, cool it and treat it. That takes energy. So, if you reduce your water use, you reduce your energy use and your greenhouse gas emissions.

When we talk about climate, we mostly think of #energy and #CO2. But between #floods, #droughts and #SeaLevelRise, climate change is largely expressed in water. So, we shouldn‚Äôt forget the link between water, energy and #GHGemissions.

We agree with many at the #COP24 #climate conference that we need more action. It‚Äôs important that governments keep moving forward. But here‚Äôs the deal: To solve #ClimateChange, you have to solve #water at the same time.
